abstracts.cdata!:
Although the project outcome is rated
            satisfactory, supported by satisfactory performances, both
            by the Bank and Borrower, sustainability is unlikely and
            institutional development impacts are only modest. A number
            of lessons of relevance to future operations in Timor-Leste
            and to operations in other post-conflict situations are
            provided, lessons especially important in three areas: local
            governance and institutional development (including in
            regards to the role of women), project management and the
            relations with the Government, and the revolving funds. The
            lack of governmental presence at local levels in the
            post-conflict situation requires that careful thought be
            given to how local level institutional development can later
            be related, to the extent possible, to emerging
            administrative or representative structures, in order to
            avoid competing authorities, side-lining of local
            non-governmental institutions developed, or wasting capacity
            and skills developed at the local level, which could be of
            value to the emerging formal structures. Local capacity
            building should remain a priority throughout a project,
            particularly with regard to regular leadership training,
            gender sensitivity training, and training in participatory
            needs assessment, and project planning. It is important to
            keep the women in the mainstream of the development process:
            the establishment of one development council, rather than
            several bodies in the community, promoted the mainstreaming
            of women in community development. Gender disaggregating
            project data is a prerequisite for a development project,
            while lack of attention to this prevents management from
            recognizing, and addressing critical gender-related issues
            appropriately. Finally, it is essential to keep the local
            governance objective high on the project agenda, and to
            actively create awareness of this at the national, as well
            as local levels to ensure that lessons learned are
            integrated into the policies of the emerging government.
